column4: does anyone have a clue why my terminals might be colorless? the only colored text i see is from the ls command. any ideas?
where do you expect color and not see it?
like.. in vim
dunno about vim
or usually my prompts (like user@host:~$) are green
does it work on the console in color?
what? -.-
which terminal emulator are you using? i get good results with xterm
i mean on the linux console, the one at control-alt-f2 (hit alt-f7 to return to the gui)
aterm, but neither xterm or gnome-terminal work either.. (oh, i'll try my tty's)
it's probably a vim issue, i guess
nope, nothing for my tty terminals either.
i know it's not a vim issue, it's not only vim
that was just an example
oh, ok. dunno then
another question, how do i like add the unstable branch to my list thingy? i want aterm 1.0, but it's not in the breezy tree
try this: perl -MTerm::ANSIColor -e 'print color green; print "foo\n"'
yeah, that works
hm
maybe something's wrong with your curses installation.. or something
i don't see why curses would be the problem
while i'm talking to you, do you know if it's possible to add the dapper list of packages to my list of repositories? i'm using breezy 5.10
